name: Access to Energy
excerpt: Access to electricity and clean cooking fuels are vital for a good standard of living and good health.

name: Age Structure
excerpt: What is the age profile of populations around the world? How did it change and what will the age structure of populations look like in the future?

name: Agricultural Production
excerpt: How much, and what types of food, do countries produce across the world?

name: Air Pollution
excerpt: Our overview of both indoor and outdoor air pollution.

name: Alcohol Consumption
excerpt: Who consumes the most alcohol? How has consumption changed over time? And what are the health impacts?

name: Animal Welfare
excerpt: See all our data, visualizations, and writing on animal welfare.

name: Antibiotics & Antibiotic Resistance
excerpt: Antibiotics revolutionized medicine, but their effectiveness is threatened by resistance. This page presents global data and research on antibiotics and antibiotic resistance.

name: Artificial Intelligence
excerpt: AI already has a large impact on our world. Explore research and data to understand the trajectory of this important technology.

name: Biodiversity
excerpt: Explore the diversity of wildlife across the planet. What are species threatened with? What can we do to prevent biodiversity loss?

name: Bioenergy and Biofuels
excerpt: How much bioenergy does the world produce, and what is it used for?

name: Books
excerpt: Books have been at the center of science and the arts for centuries. How has the production and sales of books changed over time?

name: Burden of Disease
excerpt: How is the burden of disease distributed and how did it change over time?

name: Cancer
excerpt: Cancers are one of the leading causes of death globally. Are we making progress against them?

name: Cardiovascular Diseases
excerpt: Cardiovascular diseases are the most common cause of death worldwide. Explore global data on cardiovascular diseases, their treatments, risk factors, and trends over time.

name: Causes of Death
excerpt: To find ways to save lives, it’s essential to know what people are dying from. Explore global data and research on causes of death.

name: Child & Infant Mortality
excerpt: Child mortality remains one of the world’s largest problems and is a painful reminder of work yet to be done. With global data on where, when, and how child deaths occur, we can accelerate efforts to prevent them.

name: Child Labor
excerpt: Why and where do children work? How did child labor change over time?

name: Clean Water
excerpt: Clean and safe water is essential for good health. How did access change over time? Where do people lack access?

name: Clean Water & Sanitation
excerpt: Explore global usage of clean water and sanitation.

name: Climate Change
excerpt: How are global temperatures changing, and what are the impacts on sea level rise, sea ice, and ice sheets?

name: CO2 & Greenhouse Gas Emissions
excerpt: Human emissions of greenhouse gases are the primary driver of climate change. The world needs to decarbonize to reduce them.

name: Corruption
excerpt: How does corruption vary around the world? Is corruption becoming more or less common? What should you know when using data on corruption?

name: COVID-19
excerpt: The COVID-19 pandemic has had a profound impact on the world. Explore global data and research to understand its impact, spread, and global response.

name: Crop Yields
excerpt: Increasing crop yields is crucial to improve food security, living standards, and reduce human impacts on the environment.

name: Democracy
excerpt: How has democracy spread across countries? Are we moving towards a more democratic world? Explore global data and research on democracy.

name: Diarrheal Diseases
excerpt: Diarrheal diseases are one of the leading causes of child deaths while they are largely preventable. How can we continue to make progress against these diseases?

name: Diet Compositions
excerpt: Explore data on diet compositions.

name: Economic Growth
excerpt: See all our data, visualizations, and writing on economic growth.

name: Economic Inequality
excerpt: See all our data, visualizations, and writing on economic inequality.

name: Economic Inequality by Gender
excerpt: How big are the inequalities in pay, jobs, and wealth between men and women? What causes these differences?

name: Education Spending
excerpt: How is education financed? How much do we spend on it? What are the returns?

name: Electricity Mix
excerpt: Explore data on where our electricity comes from and how this is changing.

name: Employment in Agriculture
excerpt: Explore data on employment in agriculture.

name: Energy
excerpt: Explore our data and research on global energy.

name: Energy Mix
excerpt: Explore global data on where our energy comes from, and how this is changing.

name: Environmental Impacts of Food Production
excerpt: What are the environmental impacts of food production? How do we reduce the impacts of agriculture on the environment?

name: Eradication of Diseases
excerpt: Which ones could we eradicate in our lifetimes and how?

name: Famines
excerpt: In many parts of the world famines have been common in the past. What causes famines? How can famines be averted?

name: Farm Size
excerpt: How does farm size vary across the world? How much of farmland is held by smallholders?

name: Fertility Rate
excerpt: Explore changing patterns in fertility worldwide, from birth rates to parental ages, twinning rates, reproductive technologies, and more.

name: Fertilizers
excerpt: Fertilizers supply plants with nutrients that are essential for growth.

name: Fish & Overfishing
excerpt: How are fish stocks changing across the world? How much is overfished?

name: Food Prices
excerpt: Food needs to be affordable for people, and at the same it is a key source of income for one-quarter of the world’s labor force.

name: Food Supply
excerpt: How has the availability of food changed over time? How does food supply vary across the world today?

name: Foreign Aid
excerpt: Who gives and receives foreign aid? Which forms does it take? What are examples of when it was (un-)successful?

name: Forests & Deforestation
excerpt: How are forests distributed across the world? How much do we lose to deforestation every year?

name: Fossil Fuels
excerpt: Fossil fuels were key to industrialization and rising prosperity, but their impact on health and the climate means that we should transition away from them.

name: Gender Ratio
excerpt: How does the number of men and women differ between countries? And why?

name: Global Education
excerpt: Education has expanded widely, but large gaps in learning quality still trap many children in poverty and inequality. Explore our writing and data on global education.

name: Global Health
excerpt: An overview of our research on global health.

name: Government Spending
excerpt: What do governments spend their financial resources on?

name: Happiness & Life Satisfaction
excerpt: Self-reported life satisfaction differs widely between people and between countries. What explains these differences?

name: Healthcare Spending
excerpt: How is healthcare financed? How much do we spend on it? What are the returns?

name: HIV/AIDS
excerpt: A global epidemic and the leading cause of death in some countries.

name: Homelessness
excerpt: How many people are affected by homelessness? How is their number changing over time? Explore global data and research on homelessness.

name: Homicides
excerpt: How common are homicides? How does this differ across countries? And how is this changing over time? Explore global data on homicides.

name: Human Height
excerpt: The average height of a population can inform us about the nutrition and living conditions of populations in the past for which we have little other data.

name: Human Rights
excerpt: How has the protection of human rights changed over time? How does it differ across countries, and between social groups? Explore global data on human rights.

name: Hunger & Undernourishment
excerpt: What are the consequences of undernourishment and how can we make progress against hunger and undernourishment?

name: Illicit Drug Use
excerpt: How common is the use and addiction to opioids, cocaine, amphetamines and cannabis? What is the impact?

name: Indoor Air Pollution
excerpt: Indoor air pollution – caused by the burning of firewood, crop waste, and dung for cooking and heating – is a major health risk of the world's poorest.

name: Influenza
excerpt: Flu epidemics kill hundreds of thousands of people globally each year, but countries can respond and save lives with better data.

name: Internet
excerpt: More than half of the world is online, but the Internet is still young.

name: Land Use
excerpt: How is humanity using the Earth’s land? And how can we decrease our land use so that more land is left for wildlife?

name: Lead Pollution
excerpt: Lead pollution is a widespread problem that receives little attention. What is the scale of the problem and how can we tackle it?

name: LGBT+ Rights
excerpt: How has the protection of LGBT+ rights changed over time? How does it differ across countries? Explore global data on LGBT+ rights.

name: Life Expectancy
excerpt: People are living longer across the world, but large differences remain. Explore global data on life expectancy and how it has changed over time.

name: Light at Night
excerpt: Light at night was once expensive everywhere. In some places people are still lacking light at night, while in other places light became extremely cheap.

name: Literacy
excerpt:
Being able to read and write opens up the world of education and knowledge.
When and why did more people become literate? How can progress continue?

name: Loneliness & Social Connections
excerpt: In this topic page, we explore data on loneliness and social connections and review available evidence on the link between social connections and well-being.

name: Malaria
excerpt: The deadly disease transmitted by mosquitoes is one of the leading causes of death in children. How did we eliminate the disease in some world regions and how can we continue progress against malaria?

name: Marriages & Divorces
excerpt: How is the institution of marriage changing? What percentage of marriages end in divorce? Explore global data on marriages and divorces.

name: Maternal Mortality
excerpt: What could be more tragic than a mother losing her life in the moment that she is giving birth to her newborn? Why are mothers dying and what can be done to prevent these deaths?

name: Meat & Dairy Production
excerpt: Meat is an important source of nutrition for people around the world. How quickly is demand growing? And what are the implications for animal welfare and the earth’s environment?

name: Mental Health
excerpt: Mental health has a significant impact on people’s lives and wellbeing. To support people with mental illnesses, we need better data to understand them.

name: Metals & Minerals
excerpt: Which countries produce the world’s critical minerals? How is production changing over time?

name: Micronutrient Deficiency
excerpt: Food is not only a source of energy and protein, but also micronutrients — vitamins and minerals — which are essential to good health. Who is most affected by the "hidden hunger" of micronutrient deficiency?

name: Migration
excerpt: Migration has been an important source of economic development and poverty reduction. Explore data on global migration.

name: Military Personnel & Spending
excerpt: How large are countries’ militaries? How much do they spend on their armed forces? Explore global data on military personnel and spending.

name: Mpox (monkeypox)
excerpt: Explore data on confirmed mpox cases and deaths.

name: Natural Disasters
excerpt: How many people die from disasters, and how are these impacts changing over time?

name: Neglected Tropical Diseases
excerpt: Neglected tropical diseases affect millions of people despite the existence of cheap interventions to control them.

name: Nuclear Energy
excerpt: Explore global data on nuclear energy production and the safety of nuclear technologies.

name: Nuclear Weapons
excerpt: How many states have nuclear weapons, and how many warheads do they have? How is this changing over time? Explore research and data on nuclear weapons.

name: Obesity
excerpt: When did obesity increase? How do rates vary across the world? What is the health impact?

name: Oil Spills
excerpt: How often do oil spills happen? How did the frequency of oil spills change over time?

name: Outdoor Air Pollution
excerpt: Outdoor air pollution is one of the world’s largest health and environmental problems.

name: Ozone Layer
excerpt: Humans were emitting large amounts of gases that depleted the ozone layer. But in the 1980s the world came together to tackle the problem. Emissions have fallen by more than 99%.

name: Pandemics
excerpt: The world can respond swiftly and effectively to pandemic risks with better understanding, resources, and effort.

name: Pesticides
excerpt: Pesticides are used to protect plants from weeds, fungi, or insects. Where are they used? What is their impact?

name: Plastic Pollution
excerpt: How much plastic ends up in the ocean? Where does it come from?

name: Pneumonia
excerpt: Pneumonia is the leading cause of death for children younger than 5 years.

name: Polio
excerpt: The world has made great progress against polio and two out of three types of wild poliovirus have been eradicated. This page presents global data and research on polio and the remaining challenges in eradicating the disease.

name: Population Growth
excerpt: Explore global and national data on population growth, demography, and how they are changing.

name: Poverty
excerpt: In order to make progress against poverty in the future, we need to understand poverty around the world today and how it has changed.

name: Renewable Energy
excerpt: Renewable energy sources are growing quickly and will play a vital role in tackling climate change.

name: Research & Development
excerpt: Research and development underpin nearly all of the transformative changes the world has seen.

name: Sanitation
excerpt: Safe sanitation is essential to reduce deaths from infectious diseases, prevent malnutrition, and provide dignity.

name: Smallpox
excerpt: Humanity eradicated this infectious disease globally. How was this possible?

name: Smoking
excerpt: Tobacco smoking is one of the world’s largest health problems today.

name: Space Exploration & Satellites
excerpt: Space exploration and satellites have advanced our understanding of the universe but also created new risks that need ongoing research and innovation to manage.

name: State Capacity
excerpt: Do governments worldwide have the ability to implement their policies? How has this changed over time?

name: Suicides
excerpt: Suicide rates can be reduced with greater understanding and support for people at risk.

name: Taxation
excerpt: Taxes are the most important source of government revenue. Who is paying how much and how do tax systems differ?

name: Technological Change
excerpt: Technological change underpins many of the developments we've seen in health, agriculture, energy, and global development.

name: Terrorism
excerpt: How common is terrorism? How does this differ across countries? And how is it changing over time? Explore research and data on terrorism.

name: Tetanus
excerpt: Tetanus is a bacterial infection that leads to painful muscle contractions and possibly death.

name: Time Use
excerpt: How do people across the world spend their time? How do daily activities differ across countries, and how do these differences matter for people’s lives? Explore data and research on time use.

name: Tourism
excerpt: How often do people travel for pleasure? What role does tourism play in economies across the world? Explore global data on tourism.

name: Trade & Globalization
excerpt: How have international trade and globalization changed over time? What is the structure of global trade today, and what is its impact?

name: Transport
excerpt: How are people moving around? What is its effect on the climate? Explore global data and research on transportation.

name: Trust
excerpt: Trust is essential for effective cooperation. How does trust vary between different societies and locations and what matters for levels of trust?

name: Tuberculosis
excerpt: Tuberculosis is still among the most common causes of death globally. Explore global data on tuberculosis and its trends over time.

name: Urbanization
excerpt: The world population is moving to cities. Why is urbanization happening and what are the consequences?

name: Vaccination
excerpt: Vaccines have saved millions of lives and transformed global health. This page presents data and research on their history, impact, and future.

name: Violence Against Children & Children's Rights
excerpt: How does the protection of children’s rights differ across countries? How often is violence used against them?

name: War & Peace
excerpt: How common are armed conflict and peace between and within countries? How is this changing over time? Explore research and data on war and peace.

name: Waste Management
excerpt: Explore data on waste management.

name: Water Use & Stress
excerpt: How much water do we use? How did it change over time?

name: Wildfires
excerpt: Explore global and country-level data on the extent of wildfires and how they’ve changed over time.

name: Women's Employment
excerpt: How does women’s labor force participation differ across countries? How has it changed over time? What is behind these differences and changes?

name: Women's Rights
excerpt: How has the protection of women’s rights changed over time? How does it differ across countries? Explore global data and research on women’s rights.

name: Working Hours
excerpt: How much time do people across the world spend working? How have working hours changed over time, and what do these changes matter for people’s lives? Explore data and research on working hours.
